answers.answer: that's the anxiety weighing you down the medication will help but it will take time to get better
I really don't know but if you haven't already seen a doctor I would say you should try to see one soon.

Sounds like symptoms of anxiety, I have severe anxiety and I have those same symptoms and I am 44 yrs old.Also at 17 your body could be lacking a certain vitamin, you need to have an extensive blood panel done to see if something shows.

Sounds like anxiety and panic attacks. The panic attacks will make you feel dizzy, distort sound, cause muscle tension in the chest, numbness/tingling in the extremities along with sweats. You might sometimes have a ringing in the ears during a panic attack. Body aches can often occur with depression. Depression and anxiety often occur together because of the imbalance of the neurotransmitters in the brain. I recommend seeing a psychiatrist over a regular doctor. A psychiatrist would be able to address depression/anxiety with medication and therapy if that is the problem. However, make sure you have been checked for diabetes and potassium levels, since that could account for the sweats/dizziness.

question: hey, i am only 17 years old, i have bad anxiety and hopefully getting put on new medication next month, i feel sick dizzy achy my body hurts and everybody i see seems to think im just fine i have chest pains, sometimes i feel like i cant walk i get really hot sweaty everything around me gets loud,, please explain what is causing the dizzy sick achey feeling . sometimes it goes away when i eat and sometimes it gets worse
title: sick
